sentence: 7433, “The Protection From Abusive Passengers Act” introduced by Swalwell and Brian Fitzpatrick (R-Pa.), passengers whose unruly or violent actions result in a civil or criminal penalty could be referred by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) or Department of Justice (DOJ) and placed on a “no-fly” list maintained by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA).
author: Suzanne Rowan Kelleher
title: National No-Fly List Legislation Introduced In Congress

sentence: On April 6, Sen. Jack Reed (D-R.I.) and Reps. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) and Brian Fitzpatrick (R-Pa.) introduced the Protection from Abusive Passengers Act in the Senate.
title: No, there isn’t a federal no-fly list for unruly passengers

sentence: On April 6, Sen. Jack Reed (D-R.I.) and Reps. Eric Swalwell (D-Calif.) and Brian Fitzpatrick (R-Pa.) introduced the Protection from Abusive Passengers Act in the Senate.
title: No, there isn’t a federal no-fly list for unruly passengers
